Description: Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated at l, surrounded by figures and beasts, a growling dog at r Oil
Curator's comments: For an introduction to the series of St Antony, see under no. 1907-7-17-42. As in nos. 1907-7-17-52, 58, 66, 68 and 69, St Antony is leaning on a stone table on which stand a book and a bell (see also nos. 1907-7-17-47, 49, 52, 53 and 55). The pig appears also in nos. 1907-7-17-52 (with further comment), 55, 56, 58, 65-69 and 72. 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series Lit.: H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no.1526/71, p. 266
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
